name: Introduction to Ethics
description: Course introduces students to the main philosophical questions in the field of ethics and the various approaches to answering them.

name: Metaethics
description: Course focuses on the nature of moral language and thought, the nature of moral facts and properties, and the nature of moral justification.

name: Normative Ethics
description: Course focuses on the theory of what makes an action right or wrong. It covers a range of ethical theories such as consequentialism, virtue ethics, deontology, and contractualism.

name: Contemporary Ethical Issues
description: Course focuses on the application of ethical theory to contemporary ethical issues like abortion, capital punishment, animal rights, and environmentalism.
